body: Interesting. Could you modify the test to write out the bad URLs and note them here? If a URL is bad, is it always bad, or does that vary?

> Since the above mentioned website is posting new items multiple times per day and thus the affected pages change, [...]

The affected pages change for the website I'm working with, since new content is posted daily. Also, it seems like they are not tied to specific items in the rss feed, meaning that if an items moves from page `x` to page `x+1` and page `x` was affected, page `x+1` won't necessarily be affected. 

I've just added a public method that prints all affected pages as they're found.

Another curious thing I've forgot to mention is that whether a page is affected or not changes based on if the url supplied to `Jsoup::connect` has a trailing slash or not.

Could you save the HTML from one of the failed pages?

If you get a URL that fails and immediately reload it, does it still fail? I'm trying to determine if it's deterministic based on the content, or what.
Yeah, downloaded some pages and added them to the repo. As far as I can see, a URL will stay bad for at least as long as the xml on the server does not change.
Thanks, will take a look. Guessing it's a similar issue to #967 maybe.

Thanks for reporting this and the test repro. I've committed a fix. 

The problem was that the TokeniserState checked if the CharacterReader was empty before trying to read an end tag, and the isEmpty() method didn't buffer in new contents. So if an end tag just happened to be on a buffer read boundary, isEmpty() would return false, and would cause the tokenizer to read the next section as plain text given its fallback path.

Fixed by making isEmpty do a buffer up when called externally (not when internal, which would mix the bufPos counter up).

Just in case: This bug may also happen when passing an `InputStream` to `Jsoup::parse`, I assume that got fixed in https://github.com/jhy/jsoup/commit/b92b4f6b9b3256e97bfb6a0732bf113b6da53a4c along with the other methods, but I thought I'd let you know just in case.

issue.title: Bump org.jsoup:jsoup from 1.10.3 to 1.11.2

repository.name: HiRezAPI
repository.description: Reactive Java API Wrapper for Hi-Rez Studios games. (looking for maintainer)

issue.body:
Bumps [org.jsoup:jsoup](https://github.com/jhy/jsoup) from 1.10.3 to 1.11.2.
Changelog *Sourced from org.jsoup:jsoup's [changelog](https://github.com/jhy/jsoup/blob/master/CHANGES).* > jsoup changelog > > *** Release 1.11.3 [PENDING] > * Improvement: CDATA sections are now treated as whitespace preserving (regardless of the containing element), and are > round-tripped into output HTML. > > > > * Improvement: added support for Deflate encoding. > > > * Improvement: when parsing 
 tags, skip the first newline if present.
>     
> 
>   * Improvement: support nested quotes for attribute selection queries.
>     
> 
>   * Bugfix: "Mark has been invalidated" exception was thrown when parsing some URLs on Android <= 6.
>     
> 
>   * Bugfix: The Element.text() for 
One
Two was "OneTwo", not "One Two".
>     
> 
>   * Bugfix: boolean attributes with empty string values were not collapsing in HTML output.
>     
> 
>   * Bugfix: when using the XML Parser set to lowercase normalize tags, uppercase closing tags were not correctly
>     handled.
>     
> 
>   * Bugfix: when parsing from a URL, an end tag could be read incorrectly if it started on a buffer boundary.
>       
> 
> *** Release 1.11.2 [2017-Nov-19]
>   * Improvement: added a new pseudo selector :matchText, which allows text nodes to match as if they were elements.
>     This enables finding text that is only marked by a "br" tag, for example.
>     
> 
>   * Change: marked Connection.validateTLSCertificates() as deprecated.
> 
>   * Improvement: normalize invisible characters (like soft-hyphens) in Element.text().
>     
> 
>   * Improvement: added Element.wholeText(), to easily get the un-normalized text value of an element and its children.
>     
>     
>   * Bugfix: in a deep DOM stack, a StackOverFlow exception could occur when generating implied end tags.
>     
> 
>   * Bugfix: when parsing attribute values that happened to cross a buffer boundary, a character was dropped.
> ... (truncated)
Commits - [`429f2c7`](https://github.com/jhy/jsoup/commit/429f2c7db2b60683be76d4a82fb28a561f941909) [maven-release-plugin] prepare release jsoup-1.11.2 - [`6b5b09d`](https://github.com/jhy/jsoup/commit/6b5b09d21e5a712db88a76c4547e724de42475d5) Relax test timeout a little - [`7daae31`](https://github.com/jhy/jsoup/commit/7daae314a23160ee1f3e64e106c0d50d38d5ccdf) Exclude examples from artifacts ([#700](https://github.com/jhy/jsoup/issues/700)) - [`b001b30`](https://github.com/jhy/jsoup/commit/b001b304826d33f8f2b34fc7f14a931d9a97cf8a) Renamed and changelog for wholeText - [`e6af571`](https://github.com/jhy/jsoup/commit/e6af571528c55832a015202ac4d8db9fc424d362) Add Element#getWholeText() ([#564](https://github.com/jhy/jsoup/issues/564)) - [`6b1f53e`](https://github.com/jhy/jsoup/commit/6b1f53eeafc49e6a96f868115c19509a13000d21) Spell check - [`3e4b76b`](https://github.com/jhy/jsoup/commit/3e4b76b6bbfc0ae1681d197dfacb3bf5afe0a5c1) Deprecate validateTLSCertificates - [`f4c700b`](https://github.com/jhy/jsoup/commit/f4c700b8cf147638eb09aa76a7ef4f2de70f8ea9) Added TokeniserState tests ([#859](https://github.com/jhy/jsoup/issues/859)) - [`c3f8caa`](https://github.com/jhy/jsoup/commit/c3f8caa7c16c08b803b0f34bfffdf9777c7e382c) Normalize invisibles in text() - [`3475dc8`](https://github.com/jhy/jsoup/commit/3475dc846d78e56422b3e6fdf36dfd4416f359f5) Maintain stack for namespaces - Additional commits viewable in [compare view](https://github.com/jhy/jsoup/compare/jsoup-1.10.3...jsoup-1.11.2)

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://api.dependabot.com/badges/ci_status?dependency-name=org.jsoup:jsoup&package-manager=maven&previous-version=1.10.3&new-version=1.11.2)](https://dependabot.com/compatibility-score.html?dependency-name=org.jsoup:jsoup&package-manager=maven&previous-version=1.10.3&new-version=1.11.2) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. If you'd like to skip this version, you can just close this PR. If you have any feedback just mention @dependabot in the comments below. --- **Note:** This repo was added to Dependabot recently, so you'll receive a maximum of 5 PRs for your first few update runs. Once an update run creates fewer than 5 PRs we'll remove that limit. You can always request more updates by clicking `Bump now` in your [Dependabot dashboard](https://app.dependabot.com).

issue.title: different response XML

labels.name: needs-more-info
labels.description: More information is needed from the reporter to progress the issue

repository.name: jsoup
repository.description: jsoup: the Java HTML parser, built for HTML editing, cleaning, scraping, and XSS safety.

issue.body:
Using 1.10.3  when Jsoup grab some RSSfeed, I've got the following string

```
<link>
https://www.somesite.com/link-72689/
</link> 
```

and i've got result correctly 


But using latest 1.11.3, this is the response
```
<link>
https://www.somesite.com/link-72689/</link> 

```
and messed the rest of elements.

Any idea? #

issue.title: Fix #138: Update Jsoup to 1.11.3

repository.name: okta-aws-cli-assume-role
repository.description: Okta AWS CLI Assume Role Tool

issue.body:
Problem Statement
-----------------

On OSX, users sometimes get an empty role list while Linux users do not
esperience problems. This holds even true when the same Docker image is
used.

Solution
--------

We tracked this down to the document in `AwsSamlSigninParser` (the HTML document
that represents the HTML page AWS presents for selecting roles after login to
Okta) being broken judging by string representation of the `Document` object.
However, we noticed when converting the HTML response to a string before
passing it to `Jsoup.parse`, the error disappeared:

```java
    // in AwsSamlRoleUtils.getSigninPageDocument
    Scanner s = new Scanner(samlSigninResponse.getEntity().getContent()).useDelimiter("\\A");
    String result = s.hasNext() ? s.next() : "";
    System.out.println(result);
    return Jsoup.parse(
	    result,
	    "https://signin.aws.amazon.com/saml"
    );
```

This lead us to the conclusion that this might be a race condition that
only happens when Jsoup is passed an `InputStream` which could explain why it
only happens on OSX and not Linux: Such things can propagate down right to the
operating system through boundaries of VM/Docker.

Judging from Jsoup's changelog from 1.11.2 to 1.11.3, there is a
particular [change](https://github.com/jhy/jsoup/issues/995) that sounds
like this could be the solution. Anyways, when updating to the latest
version, the error disappears completely on our OSX machines.

This is a critical bug for our company and we would be glad if this would result into a new release as soon as possible. Thanks!
